text.headline: Timeline of Addressing Water Supply Issues in the South Platte Basin
text.text: This story has presented background on hydrology and challenges and opportunities related to meet water demands. Colorado’s Water Plan provides a framework for solutions to the State's water challenges and provides guidance for future decision-making to ensure that water resources will be protected and available. The Statewide Water Supply Initiative Update provides a technical platform and methods for addressing water supply issues. This example timeline visualization illustrates how information about historical events can be presented, focusing on major water supply planning activities. Use the arrow at right to move through the timeline.

text.headline: The 2002 Drought
text.text: The historic drought of 2002 wrought profound water shortages, widespread crop losses and devastating wildfires, such as the Hayman Fire.  The drought was the impetus for the policies, studies and plans that follow.

text.headline: The Statewide Water Supply Initiative (SWSI) is first completed
text.text:
The Colorado Water Conservation Board states that for the first time they know how much water Colorado will need in 2030, how short Colorado is on water and what can be done. The South Platte Basin is predicted to have a water supply need of nearly 410,000 acre-feet.
Source: SWSI 2004.

text.headline: IBCC and Basin Roundtables are established
text.text:
The Interbasin Compact Committee (IBCC) is established by the Colorado Water for the 21st Century Act to facilitate conversations among Colorado’s river basins and to address statewide water issues. Nine basin roundtables are created and represent each of the State’s eight major river basins and the Denver metropolitan area.
Source: CWCB.

text.headline: SWSI 2010 updates the 2004 study
text.text: SWSI 2010 includes an analysis of water supply demands to 2050. It also summarizes environmental and recreational needs in each basin, as identified by basin roundtables. The key finding was that Colorado faces a shortage of water for meeting both consumptive (municipal and industrial) and environmental and recreational needs.

media.caption: Figure ES-20: 2050 M&I and SSI Gap Analysis - Medium Gap Scenario

text.headline: The South Platte and Metro basins complete a Basin Implementation Plan
text.text: The key recommendation from SWSI 2010 was that basin roundtables should determine and pursue projects and methods that address multiple purposes, including municipal, industrial, agricultural, environmental and recreational needs. This recommendation led to the creation of a Basin Implementation Plan (BIP). A website (shown at left) is created for the BIP and other important documents.

text.headline: Colorado's Water Plan is released
text.text: Colorado's Water Plan is 'a roadmap that leads to a productive economy, vibrant and sustainable cities, productive agriculture, a strong environment and a robust recreation industry. It sets forth the measurable objectives, goals and actions by which Colorado will address its projected future water needs and measure its progress.' The Water Plan's website provides monthly Implementation Updates.

text.headline: SWSI Update
text.text: The SWSI Update is currently under way and will provide a consistent statewide framework for examining future water supply and demand under different scenarios. It is expected to be completed in 2019.
